svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
February 25, 2023" date: "2023-02-25"
Eth News and Links
Shapella (Shanghai + Capella) upgrade
* Sepolia testnet upgrades to Shapella February 28
Sepolia testnet upgrades to Shapella February 28
* Consensus layer Sepolia releases: Lighthouse v3.5.0 Lodestar v1.5.0-rc.0 Nimbus
v23.2.0 Prysm v3.2.1 Teku v23.2.0
Consensus layer Sepolia releases:
* Lighthouse v3.5.0
Lighthouse v3.5.0
* Lodestar v1.5.0-rc.0
Lodestar v1.5.0-rc.0
* Nimbus v23.2.0
Nimbus v23.2.0
* Prysm v3.2.1
Prysm v3.2.1
* Teku v23.2.0
Teku v23.2.0
* Execution layer Sepolia releases: Besu v23.1.1-RC1 Ethereum JS v0.7 Erigon v2.39.0
Geth v1.11.2 Nethermind v1.17.0
Execution layer Sepolia releases:
* Besu v23.1.1-RC1
Besu v23.1.1-RC1
* Ethereum JS v0.7
Ethereum JS v0.7
* Erigon v2.39.0
Erigon v2.39.0
* Geth v1.11.2
Geth v1.11.2
* Nethermind v1.17.0
Nethermind v1.17.0
* EF blog post for Sepolia upgrade to Shapella
EF blog post for Sepolia upgrade to Shapella
* consensus-specs v1.3.0-rc.3 : adds test for validator deposit & BLS change in one
block, frees EIP4844 blobs from blocks and adds KZG API
consensus-specs v1.3.0-rc.3 : adds test for validator deposit & BLS change in one
* Latest all core devs – consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Ben Edgington &
Christine Kim : circuit breaker (fallback to local building) tested using mock builder
in Hive tests MEV-Boost running successfully on Zhejiang testnet SSE discussion so any
client (rather than just Prysm fork) can trigger block building
Latest all core devs – consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Ben Edgington &
Christine Kim :
* circuit breaker (fallback to local building) tested using mock builder in Hive tests
circuit breaker (fallback to local building) tested using mock builder in Hive tests
* MEV-Boost running successfully on Zhejiang testnet
MEV-Boost running successfully on Zhejiang testnet
* SSE discussion so any client (rather than just Prysm fork) can trigger block building
SSE discussion so any client (rather than just Prysm fork) can trigger block building
* Flashbots: MEV-Boost stack changes for Capella
Flashbots: MEV-Boost stack changes for Capella
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* KZG Ceremony: 54,000+ contributors , 4000+ in the lobby, 16 days left in first
general contribution period
KZG Ceremony:
* 54,000+ contributors , 4000+ in the lobby, 16 days left in first
* Latest EIP4844 implementers call video . Notes from Terence : client teams freeing
blobs from blocks, devnet expected in a few weeks once decoupled
Latest EIP4844 implementers call video . Notes from Terence : client teams freeing
Layer 1
* Visualization of withdrawal credentials (0x00 vs 0x01) over time
Visualization of withdrawal credentials (0x00 vs 0x01) over time
* Beverly Hills (Verkle tree) testnet is now multi-client, Nethermind synced along with
Geth
Beverly Hills (Verkle tree) testnet is now multi-client, Nethermind synced along with
* Reth (execution client) modular p2p architecture can be used as standalone component
Reth (execution client) modular p2p architecture can be used as standalone component
Research
* Recent Latest Message Driven GHOST : synchronous dynamically available & resilient to
bounded asynchronous periods, proposed replacement for Gasper’s LMD-GHOST
For Stakers
* Superphiz: best practices to avoid getting slashed (only 226 validators have been
slashed)
Superphiz: best practices to avoid getting slashed (only 226 validators have been
* Stake Local dashboard : multi-client Grafana dashboard
Stake Local dashboard : multi-client Grafana dashboard
* Beaconcha.in explorer adds BLS change signature & broadcast of voluntary exits for
Zhejiang testnet
Beaconcha.in explorer adds BLS change signature & broadcast of voluntary exits for
* Obol running distributed validator on mainnet with 98.6% average effectiveness
Obol running distributed validator on mainnet with 98.6% average effectiveness
Layer 2
* Arbitrum One tops Ethereum mainnet in transactions, first rollup to achieve more
transactions in a day than mainnet
Arbitrum One tops Ethereum mainnet in transactions, first rollup to achieve more
* Base : Coinbase layer 2 built on Optimism’s OP Stack, live on testnet, transaction
fees paid in ETH with a portion of sequencer revenue going to funding public goods
Base : Coinbase layer 2 built on Optimism’s OP Stack, live on testnet, transaction fees
paid in ETH with a portion of sequencer revenue going to funding public goods
* Optimism’s Superchain concept : network of OP Chains with shared bridge &
communication layer
Optimism’s Superchain concept : network of OP Chains with shared bridge & communication
layer
* Patrick McCorry: rollup transaction finality : sequencer’s promise, order finality
and execution settlement
Patrick McCorry: rollup transaction finality : sequencer’s promise, order finality and
execution settlement
EIPs/Standards
* New EIP core & ERC editors
New EIP core & ERC editors
* ERCs: ERC6538 : Stealth meta-address registry ERC6551 : NFT bound accounts
ERCs:
* ERC6538 : Stealth meta-address registry
ERC6538 : Stealth meta-address registry
* ERC6551 : NFT bound accounts
ERC6551 : NFT bound accounts
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Mimic !
Does your app or DAO want to automate your DeFi operations? With Mimic, you can
automate swapping, bridging and treasury management .
Check out our Smart Vaults to automate DeFi operations in a secure, trustless, and
non-custodial way.
We’ll be at EthDenver if you want to request a demo IRL. Backed by Starbloom Ventures .
Stuff for developers
* Solidity v0.8.19 : adds operators for user-defined value types and fix for deployment
bloat (code only used in creation code was included in runtime bytecode)
Solidity v0.8.19 : adds operators for user-defined value types and fix for deployment
* Solidity proposals for improving try/catch , feedback wanted
Solidity proposals for improving try/catch , feedback wanted
* Foundry: configure SMTChecker Testnet.fyi : short lived serverless testnet as a
service using Anvil & AWS, proof of concept
Foundry:
* configure SMTChecker
configure SMTChecker
* Testnet.fyi : short lived serverless testnet as a service using Anvil & AWS, proof of
concept
Testnet.fyi : short lived serverless testnet as a service using Anvil & AWS, proof of
* Statistical approximation in Solidity
Statistical approximation in Solidity
* AztecConnectAuction : cross-chain sealed-bid auction using Aztec Connect
AztecConnectAuction : cross-chain sealed-bid auction using Aztec Connect
* Solidity external library cost Blur airdrop claimers $34k, internal would have saved
~2600 gas each
Solidity external library cost Blur airdrop claimers $34k, internal would have saved
* Huffmate v1.1 (contract library in Huff): SendEthers utility, ECDSA & BytesLib
implementation
Huffmate v1.1 (contract library in Huff): SendEthers utility, ECDSA & BytesLib
* EVM disassembly guide : navigating metadata & why bytecode 6142 breaks most
disassemblers
EVM disassembly guide : navigating metadata & why bytecode 6142 breaks most
* sol2uml v2.5.0 : storage variables are parsed in contract storage diagrams
sol2uml v2.5.0 : storage variables are parsed in contract storage diagrams
* ContractReader.io adds live inline values
ContractReader.io adds live inline values
* Seaport v1.4 : fix for v1.3 so zone & contract offerer checks applied after transfers
Seaport v1.4 : fix for v1.3 so zone & contract offerer checks applied after transfers
* Alchemy Create Web3 Dapp : NextJs based starter kit with components & templates
Alchemy Create Web3 Dapp : NextJs based starter kit with components & templates
* Emojimon : guide to create Pokémon-inspired on-chain game using MUD stack
Emojimon : guide to create Pokémon-inspired on-chain game using MUD stack
* EKO2022 CTF Phoenixtto solution
EKO2022 CTF Phoenixtto solution
* Ethernaut CTF solutions in Huff (added to solutions in Vyper)
Ethernaut CTF solutions in Huff (added to solutions in Vyper)
* Gitcoin Passport Scorer API : gate apps based on passport score
Gitcoin Passport Scorer API : gate apps based on passport score
* SuperNova implementation in Rust, experimental
SuperNova implementation in Rust, experimental
Security
* Oasis multisig upgraded a contract to recover funds from Wormhole exploiter based on
UK court order
Ecosystem
* Danny Ryan’s reflections on the state of Ethereum : technological concerns, execution
layer client diversity, core dev incentives, capture, ossification and L2 alignment
Danny Ryan’s reflections on the state of Ethereum : technological concerns, execution
* Tim Beiko: testnet past, present & future : Goerli: test validator setups, EthStaker
offer low Goerli ETH deposits, deprecated Holešovice: planned for later this year as
replacement for Goerli Sepolia: test apps, no supply issues as Sepolia ETH supply can
be inflated Ephemery : test validator setups on ephemeral testnet
Tim Beiko: testnet past, present & future :
* Goerli: test validator setups, EthStaker offer low Goerli ETH deposits, deprecated
Goerli: test validator setups, EthStaker offer low Goerli ETH deposits, deprecated
* Holešovice: planned for later this year as replacement for Goerli
Holešovice: planned for later this year as replacement for Goerli
* Sepolia: test apps, no supply issues as Sepolia ETH supply can be inflated
Sepolia: test apps, no supply issues as Sepolia ETH supply can be inflated
* Ephemery : test validator setups on ephemeral testnet
Ephemery : test validator setups on ephemeral testnet
* EF Q4 grantees share $4.4million in funding
EF Q4 grantees share $4.4million in funding
* MetaMask disabling eth_sign RPC signature method by default
MetaMask disabling eth_sign RPC signature method by default
Enterprise
* Spotify pilots NFT gated playlists on Android in selected countries
Application layer
* Synthetix v3 deployed on mainnet & Optimism
Synthetix v3 deployed on mainnet & Optimism
* Aave voted to freeze BUSD reserve on v2
Aave voted to freeze BUSD reserve on v2
* ENS ETHDenver custom sticker pack pre-register and set your avatar
ENS ETHDenver custom sticker pack pre-register and set your avatar
* NFT marketplace wars: Blur NFT trading volume : 20% from 15 wallets, 50% from ~300
wallets 125k ETH NFT wash trade (0% marketplace fee) via flash loan Uniswap : use any
ERC20 token to buy NFTs Dankrad Feist’s explainer for creators: NFT contracts can’t
enforce royalties
NFT marketplace wars:
* Blur NFT trading volume : 20% from 15 wallets, 50% from ~300 wallets
Blur NFT trading volume : 20% from 15 wallets, 50% from ~300 wallets
* 125k ETH NFT wash trade (0% marketplace fee) via flash loan
125k ETH NFT wash trade (0% marketplace fee) via flash loan
* Uniswap : use any ERC20 token to buy NFTs
Uniswap : use any ERC20 token to buy NFTs
* Dankrad Feist’s explainer for creators: NFT contracts can’t enforce royalties
Dankrad Feist’s explainer for creators: NFT contracts can’t enforce royalties
* Ethereum Postal Service : send physical letters via a contract call (but don’t dox
anyone)
Ethereum Postal Service : send physical letters via a contract call (but don’t dox
* Backed bCOIN tokenized tracker of Coinbase COIN, non-US qualified investors only
Backed bCOIN tokenized tracker of Coinbase COIN, non-US qualified investors only
Job Listings
* Frax Finance is expanding their official core developer team. Apply here!
Frax Finance is expanding their official core developer team. Apply here!
* Immutable is hiring a Protocol Blockchain Engineer .
Immutable is hiring a Protocol Blockchain Engineer .
* Cyfrin.io is hiring senior security engineers $190k-$300k.
Cyfrin.io is hiring senior security engineers $190k-$300k.
* Request Network is hiring a Community & Communication Manager
Request Network is hiring a Community & Communication Manager
* Shell Protocol team is hiring senior Solidity devs & more , remote or Hawaii
Shell Protocol team is hiring senior Solidity devs & more , remote or Hawaii
* Certora is hiring a Senior Enterprise Sales Rep .
Certora is hiring a Senior Enterprise Sales Rep .
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit), payable in ETH/DAI/USDC to
abcoathup.eth on mainnet or Layer 2. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* US regulators guidance for banks on liquidity risks from crypto entities
US regulators guidance for banks on liquidity risks from crypto entities
* FTX Japan reopens withdrawals
FTX Japan reopens withdrawals
* Forsage founders charged with fraud in Ponzi scheme
Forsage founders charged with fraud in Ponzi scheme
* Jon Charbonneau: how value flows through Ethereum and why issuance is misunderstood
Jon Charbonneau: how value flows through Ethereum and why issuance is misunderstood
General/crypto
* Coinbase: lessons to learn from social engineering attack
Coinbase: lessons to learn from social engineering attack
* Trail of Bits: VSCode extensions & VSCode vulnerabilities disclosed
Trail of Bits: VSCode extensions & VSCode vulnerabilities disclosed
* Static analysis detectors for common vulnerabilities in Circom programs
Static analysis detectors for common vulnerabilities in Circom programs
* wienr : CLI reader for Week in Ethereum News
wienr : CLI reader for Week in Ethereum News
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-february-25-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Feb 27 – deadline for EF academic grants round
Feb 27 – deadline for EF academic grants round
* Feb 28 – Sepolia testnet upgrades to Shapella
Feb 28 – Sepolia testnet upgrades to Shapella
* Mar 2-5 – ETHDenver Hackathon
Mar 2-5 – ETHDenver Hackathon

Mar 10-29 – Scaling Ethereum (ETHGlobal) virtual
* Mar 11 – Ethereum Guatemala
Mar 11 – Ethereum Guatemala

Mar 28-30 – Ethereum Rio

Apr 12-14 – NFT NYC

Apr 14-16 – ETHGlobal Tokyo

Apr 14-16 – EthereumZuri.ch conference & hackathon

Apr 21-25 – EthTaipei hackathon & conference

Apr 27-30 – Istanbul ETH Privacy conference & hackathon

May 5-7 – ETHMalaysia conference & hackathon

May 5-7 – ETHTallinn hackathon

May 9-10 – NFT Tallinn conference

May 19-23 – EDCON Montenegro (changed from Vienna)

May 20-21 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon

May 26–28 – ETHGlobal Istanbul

Jun 2-4 – ETH Seoul

Jun 9-11 – ETHPrague conference & hackathon

Jun 23–25 – ETHGlobal Toronto

Jul 5-7 – ETHBarcelona

Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)
* Jul 21–23 – ETHGlobal Paris
Jul 21–23 – ETHGlobal Paris
